text: Draught at Fermentoren, Copenhagen, Jan 2014Cloudy dark amber color with creamy head. Aroma of caramel, candi sugar, candies, rye, lightly fruity. Smoot, round, with very nice caramel flavor, rye touch, fruity esters, and correct bitterness.Well brewed and interesting, indeed.
Deep red with white head. Insensely sweet aroma of plumbs and prunes. Very sweet taste. Lightly sour and light bitterness. Dry finish. Interesting and nice but a bit too sweet I think.

Bottle. Sweet banana and toffee aroma. Pours dark brown with an off white head. Highly carbonated. Very sweet flavour with toffee and some fruity notes. Medicinal texture, More malty sweetness in the finish.

More of a US Rye than a traditional offering. Deep unfiltered ruby-red brown body. Foamy off-white head. Not really a style to my liking, Im tired of overly sweet Rye beer in general. A touch oxidized. Interesting fruity notes almost make me think Saison yeast. Not an exceptional beer, pretty much standard brewpub quality though, maybe a pinch better.

330ml bottle. @home 20-05-2015.
BBD: 03-04-2015.
Courtesy of lukasmh. Thanks a lot!
In short: robust amber ale.
Pours quite hazy dark copper with frothy light tan head. Moderate head retention, some lacing. Malty, caramel, liquorice, raisins aromas. Medium body, average carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is slightly bitter, earthy, resins, some roasty, caramel. Strong beer, enjoyable.

Pours clear amber-brown with three fingers of pillowy tan head, excellent retention and lacing. (4/5) Nose is molasses, green spruce tips, bready caramel malt, floral. (6/10) Taste is moderate sweet, moderate bitter, slight spiciness. (6/10) Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, lightly spicy finish. (4/5)

Feels very nordic - the combination of spicy rye, green wood, and dark malt feels like something that would be very appropriate to drink in the nordic darkness waiting for spring to arrive... He said, drinking in the nordic darkness, waiting for spring to arrive. Definitely an old-fashioned, hearty brew. (14/20)

draught @ Cph Appearance: pours hazy red-brown with ok soapy off-white head and some lacing. aroma/taste: caramel, bread, rye and some, 
floral notes. palette: medium carbonation, medium body, some caramel sweetness, average bitterness, medium duration and an oily texture. Overall: well balanced and tasteful ale
How: Bottle Appearance: red/brown color small to medium head. Aroma: spice, caramel, smoke, fruit. Palate: medium body, soft carbonation.

Tap @ Ølhus Stockholm, Helsinki. Pours a brownish amber with a good, beige head. Aroma is a lot of rye, juniper berries. Taste is rye, caramel, yeast, banana, quite sweet. Too much so to be pleasant. Fairly full, smooth, light carbonation.

Draught. Pours hazy amber in color with an off-white head. Bready maltyness, hints of spicyness and bit of rye in aroma. Dark breadyness and malty sweetness in taste. Roasted and quite dry finish. Burnt wooden and dark chocolatey notes in the end.
Medium brown color. Big rye malty, (a bit of pepper?!?)slightly sweet backbone. Last rye malty finish. Very nice

Tap@ølhus cph. Reddish hazy. Sweet malty, ryeish, very malty nose. Med,full bodied, slight oily, some alchohol, sweet malty, dried fruity, some smokyness. Very flavourful ale. And good, if your into bocks and other slight sweet powerfully,malty brews. Ok though, even if not.-- bb

Draught@Ølhus Kobenhavn, Helsinki. Murky brown color, lasting off-white head. Sweet, slightly fruity aroma. Juicy malt flavor with oak and some winy notes. Smoky finish with rye. Full body, medium-light carbonation. Seems more like a barley wine than a porter. Not bad, though.
Draught at Ølhus Kobenhavn. Bittersweet taste with citrus, hops, toffee, earthy notes, yeast and ripe fruits. Bittersweet finish with citrus, toffee, yeast and nuts. Very nice brew.

Bottle. Peach pulp, toffee malt, and light alcohol aroma. Cloudy brown with small head. Sweet banana, orange, rye malt, and lightly bitter herbal flavor. Nice body. Very good - weizen/sahti characteristics.

Bottle:
Pours cloudy brown with a thick, foamy tan head.
Caramel, rye, brown sugar scent.
Flavour is spicy rye, caramel malt.
Sweet, with a spicy herbal finish.
Very nice.
"an ok norweigan farmhouse ale. dark, light-medium bodied. a little rye and dark fruit on the nose and flavor. pretty good, and pretty simple. probably a one timer."

På flarra Bishops Malmö. Dags betygsätta udda öl . Med det menas nåt udda? Öhh ja . Doften Sötaktigt fruktigt pilsner toner . Smakar annorlunda sött påminner om imperial pilsner med gräsiga ja blött gräs. Lagom beska i förhållande till hmmm alkoholen. Ja en öl värd testa lite Kul med Råg Ale stuket.

Aroma is dark fruits, brown sugar and wild yeast. Taste is rich sweet malts and fruits. Some light alcohol bite on finish. Appearance is a amber / orange bidy which is very cloudy and mirky. The pearl head is thin and doesnt retain very well.

500 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy orangeish brown with a nice beige head. Aroma is spicy, chocolatey. Flavor is light chocolate, brown sugar, cream sugar, some caramel. Finish is spicy, a herbal touch. Lingering chocolate, caramel and spices. Medium to full body, sticky mouthfeel, average carbonation.

Rating #988, flaske fra Toft Vin. En helt bordeauxrød øl med vanillefarvet holdbart skum. Sød og maltet duft med overmodne frugter, blommer, bær og masser af karamel. Tankerne bliver ledt hen på både barley wine og kirsebærsauce. Sød smag af bær, blommer og masser af karamel, samt en solid bitter eftersmag. Medium tyk og ret cremet mundfylde.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Une bouteille de 500ml (avec Slovak mais pas en même temps). Un liquide dorée foncée quasi brunâtre avec des reflets rouges. Un premier nez de vieux caramel avec des épices provenant du seigle. Une bouche sucrée sans envergure avec des saveurs vieillottes et surtout cette finale tout en sucre. Décevant.

Une bouteille de 50 cl partagée avec rodenbach99. Une robe ambrée qui tire vers le brun. Une mousse abondante qui laisse une longue traînée. Un nez de pain de seigle et de caramel avec des effluves de chocolat. Un goût bien malté avec un petit côté bonbon. Une bouche huileuse et peu remuée par les bulles. Une finale légèrement épicée avec une douceur qui pourrait bien plaire aux gens qui ont la dent sucrée.

Aroma: Vegemite, malt, spirit
App: red brown tan head 
Flavour: malt, light grain with balanced hop bitterness and dark fruit 
Palate: finishes lightly burnt and malty 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours amber with a small offwhite head. Aroma is sweet with roasted malts, kandi and grain, as well as some hops in the back. Flavour is sweet and malty, with grain, kandi and leather, with a sweetly balanced finish.

Bouteille de 500 ml obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie au coût de 9.55$. Arôme: Odeur de céréale avec une pointe herbacée. Apparence: La couleur est brune. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréale et de caramel avec une pointe dépices. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement houblonné. (Rating #5612)

Keg at the Euston Tap - London. Pours clear caramel-amber with a creamy, off-white head. The nose has ripe fruits, toffee, berries. Medium to big sweet flavor with hefty bready malts, toffee, ripe fruits, gummy grapes. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Lightly warming to finish with lots of sticky sugars, ripe fruits, more gummies, toffee. Enjoyable in small doses.

Keg at Pint, Cambridge, Sunday 8th June 2014  Pours reddy chestnut colour with off-white head, burnt caramel actually quite a toffee flavour with. Quite a big muscley beer, possibly not the mistcrefreshing on such a wonderful day as this.  A7 A4 T7 P3 Ov14 3.5

Tap at Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Hazy red with barely any head on top. Chewy bonfire toffee, anise, berries. Lots of rye spice flowing through. Strong, thick barleywine-esque feel to the palate. Little old-fashioned, foresty, twiggy hints keep things interesting. Very nice stuff.

Tap @ Fermentoren. Pours a slight murky, dark orange beer with a small off white head on top. Aroma is very herbal, touches of cinnamon and clove. Flavor is moderately sweet, faint herbal, touches of cinnamon and red fruits in the backend. Short, medium sweet finish. Mmmkay.

Draught @ Fermentoren. Opaque hazy reddish color, small beige head. Aroma is a bit weird, plant like, herbal, slightly sweetish. Taste malts, a bit sweetish, lightly herbs again and a light floral touch. Medium body and carbonation.

Tap at Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Poured a murky dark amber with a frothy light off-white head. The aroma is malt, wheat rye light toffee and citrus fruit. The flavour is medium bitter with a rich fruit alcohol bitter palate and a short bitter finish. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation. A really chewy beer. Lots of flavour and very satisfying. Shame about the ABV. Id like to drink this in pints but I also value my ability to remain upright :-)

pours hazy dark golden, almost copper with a small yet reviving off-white head showing some retention and lacing. spicy graininess, but mostly caramel - somewhat linear, fruity - laer-like fruitiness if not munich-like maltiness, grass, pepper and other spices. average carbonation - slightly foamy, light to medium body - oily, sweetish and grassy-spicy finish. tad unbalanced. ok.

Bottle at the City Pub, Goteborg, 21/03/14.
Dark mahogany brown with an off white covering.
Nose is bitter fruit rind, dark stoned fruits, sweet tones, caramel.
Taste comprises much the same, toffee, light spice, dried fruits.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
So so affair.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
DUft: meget kraftig duft af humle. og en smule sød duft
smag: meget smag af humle. og en fin sødme. meget lækker øl

Tap at fermentoren . Pours Dark cloudy amber. Aroma of sweet grains, dark caramel malts, sweet biscuit, some grassy hops and corn. Taste of sweeter hops, sweet grains, caramel malts, corn and some nutty notes. Also some warming alcohol. Traditional shit!

How: Bottle.
Where: City Pub, Göteborg.
Appearance: Amber colour with an off-white head.
Aroma: Malt, vanilla, caramel, citrus, hops.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, caramel, raisin, vanilla, alcohol.

500ml bottle, dark amber hue, with a beige head, nice grainy toasted, roasted, caramel, rye malty nose, with a faint spicy peppercorn, fruity yeast accent of rie apples and apple sauce, with a light floral leafy hop, faint nutty, caramelized bread crumbs note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a nice spicy, fruity, yeasty, ripe apple, muesli cereal, apple crumble, grainy toasted, caramelized, biscuity, rye malty character, with a light flowery leafy hop, carmalized bread crumbs, faint nutty flavour, leading towards a yeasty, fruity, grainy rye, toasted, caramelized, biscuity maltiness, fruity, lingering leafy, citrus hop bitterness finish.

Bottle at Coty Pub, Göteborg. Clear deep amber beer with a rich lasting offwhite head. Malty vanilla aroma, caramel, fruity, cream, grapes, citrus, hop notes. Malty vanilla and cream flavor, biscuits, some warming alcohol, honey, some rye.

Brown bottle, 0.5 l, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savoured on March 4 2014; eye: dark brown with a caramel hue, hazy, tiny sheet of tan head, average lacing; nose: malt, caramel, slight ashy, spices, fig; mouth: malt, caramel, slight ashy, slight spices, light alcohol, fig, finale in malt with slight ashy presence, medium body, average carbonation, mildly sweet, liqueur-like texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 0,5 l, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savourée le 4 mars 2014; il : brun foncé avec une teinte caramel, trouble, petite couverture de mousse fauve, dentelle moyenne; nez : malt, caramel, très léger cendré, très léger épices, figue; bouche : malt, caramel, très léger cendré, très léger épices, léger alcool, figue, finale en malt avec très légère présence cendrée, corps moyen, carbonatation moyenne, moyennement sucrée, texture liquoreuse; en résumé : bien

My Bottom Line:
Spicy rye and hefty malt sweetness benefit from candied fruitiness and light floral notes in this rich pint of nostalgia.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A ring of foam laces atop the misty dark red.
-The mouthfeel and malt profile on this one have some Doppelbock qualities.
-Alcohol is a no show in the flavour profile.
-This is low on the hop bitterness, making the body feel even heavier.

Bottle.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2014 Bottle to tulip glass. App.: Opaque brown amber with a tiny beige head. Aroma: Farmhouse with spices, some sweetness covered by oxydation. Taste: Very sweet taste, caramel kind with some spices. Low bitterness that appear once the sweetness is gone. Palate: Full bodied with a creamy texture, pretty lively. Good, not a personnal favorite, seems to be unsure where its headed.

Pours a cloudy brown with an average dull white head and just a bit of lace. Aroma is fruity esters, farmhouse, caramel, rye, spicey, and bread. Flavour is caramel, rye, spice, residual sweetness, fruity esters, mild bitterness, and a touch bready.

Bottle: Poured a deep clear brown color ale with a medium size foamy head with OK retention with some light lacing. Aroma of light spicy rye notes with some light hoppy notes. Taste is also dominated by light spicy rye notes with medium hoppy finish with light residua sugar notes. Body is about average with good carbonation. Enjoyable but not really memorable.
Pretty good traditonal ale, 750ML from Andrews Cheese Shop in Santa Monica

Bottle (500 ml). Reddish brown with a small beige head and little lacing. Aroma is mostly of spices/rye (mostly), caramel and light fruity notes. Taste is also mostly of rye with moderate sweetness, caramel, light fruity notes and a somewhat bitter finish. Medium body. Medium/good carbonation. Spicy/dry finish. Lack of balance and too much rye forward. Not bad per se, but certainly not one for the ages.
Mørk brun tåkete med hvitt høyt skum som ligger godt. Krydder og karamellukt. Veldig søt i smaken. medium bitter, kort ettersmak. Lite kullsyre.
Bottle. Pours hazy brown with thick lasting white to light brown head. Aroma is candy, smoke, malt with some fruity tones. Flavor is malt, smoke, spices, fruits. Smoky aftertaste.

Láhev 330 ml. Aroma je příjemné, je znát po praeném sladu a v pozadí jsou lehce znát růe s jemnými vanilkovými podtóny. Pěna je světle hnědé barvy, krémově jemná, vysoká a drící. Barva samotného piva je opravdu úasná rubínová se středně silným zakalením a větími kousky sladu. Chuť je velmi výrazně sladová s nádechem praeného sladu a kávy v pozadí je také znát slabí náznak hořké čokolády a tření, okraje jsou jemné perníkové a fini je středně kávově hořký a drící. Toto pivo je opravdu velmi krásné pro oko, zároveň jeho chuť je opravdu pestrá a výrazná, má méně výrazné ale za to té krásné aroma, celkově se jedná o velmi zajímavý záitek.
Flaske fra vinmonopolet. Prøver sakte å komme seg ut av flaska.Klar mørkebrun farge, moderat skumtopp.medium karbonert. Smaker malt, karamell,brunt sukket, urter, gjær. En god øl.

Clear, dark amber body with a small, short-lived, light-brown head. Strong and sweet aroma with a vinous feel, notes of caramel, burnt sugar, dark fruits and spices (is that anise in the back?). Lots of sweetness in the taste, almost a bit too much, and there isnt much bitterness to back up the sugar attack. Flavours of alcohol, caramel, burnt sugar, dark fruits, spices and herbs. Full bodied, smooth and creamy texture, soft carbonation. A good one, even though I dont find it as amazing as the average Ratebeerian. 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 16 months before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Vika, Oslo]
330ml bottle from Archive Beer Boutique. Big deep head of honeycomb coloured foam. The beer is deep amber in colour with a fullness in the mouth that is very satisfying.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2013 Bottle @ home .. New Label as NORDIC RYE ALE .. Brew at De Proef, Belgium It pours light murky dark brown with a medium light brown head  very nice looks! the aroma is banana, light roasted malt, caramel, brown sugar and light dark fruits. The flavor is light roasted malt, light burnt caramel, brown sugar, bitter citrus hops, biscuits with some alcohol finish

Body is dark ruby with low creamy head, medium lasting. Aroma has sweet caramel notes with ongoing bitterness in the background. Little bit roasted with rye hints. Taste is sweet with low bitterness, noble. Body is medium, with light carbonation.
Bottle. Sweet, grainy and boozy. The bitterness comes from spices, rather than the hops.

[20-OCT-2013] Draught at EurHop Beer Festival (EBF) 2013 in Rome. Pours orange to bronze with a small head, aroma of toffee, caramel and some coffee, flavor of dark bread, caramel and coffee, medium bodied

[10/20/13] Draught at Eurhop Beer Festival 2013 in Rome. Clear deep amber. Aroma of malt, caramel, rye spiciness and a bit of fruitiness. Sweetish malty flavor, caramelly, a bit toasty, with some rye, light fruitiness and a drier finish with light bitterness. Medium-bodied.
Zuckrig getreidiger Antrunk. Die Getreidenoten bleiben vorhanden, leider auch die Süße. Die Malzigkeit wird intensiver, süffig, durch die Getreidigkeit wird die Süße etwas zurück gedrängt. 9/8/9/9//9
UPDATED: OCT 28, 2013 Bread and chocolate aroma. Flavor much like aroma with some rye bitterness. A really good beer but not worth the $10 price tag.

Sample at SBWF 2013. 

Amber with a white head. Aroma and taste of malt, nuts, caramel, bread and some berries. Medium body and with quite a lot of carbonation. An ok beer.
Det här var en god sak med mycket smak av karamell, sötma, sviskon och malt. Kroppen var stabil och balansen behagligt närvarande.

Pours amber with a large head.
Nose shows bready and nutty malt along with sweet melanoidin notes and a spicy, bready rye hit.
Big malt notes as flavours but theres a weird minty note throughout too.
Carbonation is pretty damn aggressive.

Pours a close to amber with a thick and creamy light tanned head. Aroma of honey and candy, very sweet and somewhat malty. Taste is malty and sweet with a creamy mouthfeel. Has a decent bitterness in the aftertaste, and is surprisingly dry.
Fad: Brunorange let diset øl med et fint skumhoved. Duften er meget maltet sødlig, ligesom smagen. Det fungerer rigtig godt. Dejlig øl.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 Old rating rerated 13.08.2013, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Small mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet fruity, caramel, raisins, malts, almond cake, sugar, grass, grain. Taste is kind of metallic and sweet, caramel malts, hops, dried fruits, almond essence, dark sugar, roasted grain, grass. Medium bitterness. Not my kind of beer.

Bottle @ sommerfest Nyborg, 3/8 2013. Dark orange clear, small off white head that settles quickly, good lacing. Aroma, malty, bread, grass, hay, . Taste, malty, bread, toffee, peppery spiciness, . Dry bitter aftertaste, with a nice alcoholic warmth. Great rye beer.
In bottle. Smells like biscuits and molasses. Tastes like barley sugar, spices with a bitter finish. A bit sweet and quite bubbly.
On tap at Crowbar, Oslo. Hazy red copper, small head. Spicy malt aroma, semi-dry spicy caramel. A bit complex, but well-crafted and interesting.

Sample from tap, CBF 2013. Deep amber colour with a reddish hue. Small, off-white head. Sweet, roasted aroma with ryebread, licorice, caramel and chocolate malts. Taste is sweet and roasted. Medium body, creamy texture. Finishes dry, roasted and bitter with dark, dried fruits. I like ryebread...
330 ml bottle. Aroma faint and sweet, bready, caramel and spice. Taste is rich, malty and full, spicy with bitter finish. Nice

New Beer Distributors, NY 50cl ($8.75): Pours a dark brown with a brown head that leaves lacing. Aroma is rye, roasted malts, a hint of booze, and a bit of burnt toast. Taste is very roasty. There is a bit of sugar. Some hoppiness. Rye is pretty evident. Taste is rather unique, but falls within a class of Scandinavian ales that have somewhat similar characteristics. Very drinkable nevertheless.

50 cl bottle @ Timo A. Batch #592, brewed on 16.02.2011, BBE 16.02.2014.
Pours clear ruby red color with a small head. Aroma has a distinct Nøgne Ø house aroma, some sweet hoppy fruits, caramel malts, yeast and dark berries and hints of rye. Flavor of sweet caramel, malts, some fruits and hops, rye, mild oat notes and some yeast. Quite nice.
4426

500 ml bottle. Thanks Timo A.
Pours a dark amber brown colour with a white head. Aroma of roasted malts, nuts, some raisins and grass. Flavour of roasted malts, chocolate, smoked wood, yeast and bitterness. Some salty licorice notes. Full bodied, smooth mouthfeel and a rich, malty, chocolate finish. Really pleasant.
Bottle 0.5l from Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Colour is reddish dark brown with some white head. Aromas and flavours are rye bread, some smoke and sweetness. Too carbonated.
Cloudy brown color with a good foam as last long. Sweet fruity aroma. Sweet malty caramel flavor. A little too strong.

Poured a dark brown colour with a restrained tan head. Aroma was roasted dark malts, chocolate and booze. The rye aspect was more pronounced in the flavour  which had notes of spice, roast, ash and malts, with some bitterness coming through towards the finish.
Good, but slightly hard going.

On draft at Churchkey in D.C.

The beer is a dark chestnut hue, with 1/4" of tan head that leaves sparse lacing on the snifter. The aroma is very inviting, with malt, bread, pine, hops. The flavor surpasses my expectations. Rye and hops are balanced extremely well, and the beer has a bold, delicious flavor. The beer is medium bodied, with solid carbonation. Alcohol is masked quite well. A terrific brew, I would certainly have this again.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 08-15-2011

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika.
Dark / reddish color, good foam.
Smoked aromas, malt, coffee, some dried fruits and light hoppy notes- also licorice.
medium/ full body & high complexity.
Solid bitterness, some immediate sweetness - some sourness, ok balance .
Very enjoyable
Bottle. Lovely dark ruby. Smooth beer, nice edge of rye sourness. Well balanced, highly drinkable.
caramel, bread, dark chocolate, licorice, brown, light brown foam,light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, nice tasty finish.

Dark brown, almost black. Hazy. Has an off-white head, mostly lasting. Dark aroma, roasted, laqurice, dry coffee, dark chocolate, real nice. Good flavor too, more of the dark notes, dry coffee, roasted bread. Moderate bitter finish. Creamy, dry texture and soft carbonation. Have to buy one to Barak! ;o)

Poured from a 500ml bottle. This is an interesting beer. Notes of chocolate, rye, a fruity quality, bready, slight tartness. Hot alcohol notes are noticeable. Highly carbonated. Much better at room temperature.
thick smokey rye with some fairly strong alcohol warmth. flavor is sweet at first but balance by some hop bitterness and alcohol. somewhat malty and roasty. delicious.

Dark cloudy brown (almost black) colour with a beige head. Roasted malt, coffee and a bit hoppy nose. Moderate sweetness. Mostly roasted malt and coffee. Maybee some licorice. A bit dry texture.[Bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika in Oslo, Norway]
Draught. Cloudy brown colour. Rye. Yeasty, and quite bitter hops. A little unbalanced. Difficult beer.

500mL bottle.  Poured slightly hazy smoked amber with a quick-forming, well-retained beige head.  The aroma picked up cherry dust, toasted chocolates, and an array of herbs over rye bread and a hint of salted bacon.. warm, well-balanced sugars stuck on the back of the nose.. I really enjoyed it.  The flavor found more drawn caramel than anything else at the core, with some chocolate and rye bread too.. herbal and earthy spices around, along with light sourness and black peppery warmth.. finished dry and grainy, with more tartness and tasty malts.  Medium-bodied and well-carbonated on the palate.. good balance between the components, and it was engaging.. Id gladly drink this again.

Pours cloudy burnt copper brown, minimal tan head that fades to a faint ring. Raisin, fig, caramel malt, roasted coffee beans, yeast on the nose. On the palate, medium bodies with rye and spicy heat from the ABV. More dark fruit flavors along with caramel malt sweetness. Long roasted bitterness and spice on the finish. This grew on me as we sipped. Pretty good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Muddy brown in colour with a long lasting beige head, good lacing.  The aroma of sweet fruits, bread, caramel, some burnt malts, raisins, light rye.  The flavour is of rye bread, very malty, burnt and quite sweet, chocolate with some caramel.  Sweet mouthfeel, medium body, moderate carbonation.  FInishes long, sweet, roasty.

Not quite what I was expecting but good non-the-less.

500ml bottle from the Premier Gourmet in Buffalo, New York.
Opened on March 22, 2012.
No date.

500ml bottle @ Pikkulintu, Helsinki
Batch 592, brygget 160211, BBE 160214

Pours dark brown with a smooth foamy head. Aroma of roasted malts, rye, sweet licorice and hops. Taste of roasted malts, some rye, sweet licorice, earthy notes and hops. Finish is malty and roasty with a distinct Nøgne taste. Okay, quite tasty roasted ale, reminds me a bit of an aged Nøgne #100.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2015 
50 cl bottle at Olutravintola Pikkulintu. Batch #592: brewed 16.02.2011, BBE 16.02.2014
Aroma has rather clear Nøgne Ø house flavour with roastiness, coffee and a floury feeliing. Flacour has almost burned and slightly sweet malt and espresso. Hoppy finish with ash and a sticky feeling. Good, much more roastd than it looks.

50 cl bottle @ Timo A. Same batch.
As good as I remembered  theres a licorice feeling I didnt notice before. Almost raised to 4.0.

Draught @ Ølhus Stockholm
Sweet, berry juice, some alcohol. A bit syrupy. Not as roasted or good as the bottle was. Harsh score estimate: 3.7.

Bottle. Moderate malt aromas of grain, roasted and mild coffee, light to moderate resin for the hops, moderate earth for the yeast with woos, charcoal and a hint of licorice. Head is large, fizzy turning rocky, light tan with good lacing and good legs and is mostly lasting. Color is clear mahogany. Flavor starts moderately sweet and lightly acidic, then finishes lightly sweet and acidic and moderately bitter. Palate is on the fuller side of medium, creamy with a soft carbonation and a a little chalky in the finish. A nice mix of Black IPA and French Farmhouse Ale in this Traditional Ale.

500ml bottle (Pikkulintu, Helsinki)
Looks great, rich browny red, huge tight bready tight head, lasts for ever. Smell is classic liquid bread, rye bread of course. Super smooth palate, gentle carbonation. Lovely rye bready taste, some toastiness, a little bit soapy and metallic too alas, but they dont impinge too much. Quite a lot of the rye grain aromatics, elevated by the alcohol which otherwise doesnt notice at all. Lovely  full smooth relaxing brew, Good to the bottom of the bottle. As soon as I started on this I put the Birra De Mare to one side, that was poor compared to this.

Bottle, picked up at Pilsen Xmas beer markets. Brownish amber with a minimal head; aroma of grapefruit, leather and honey; minimal rye character verging on oaty, plenty of bitterness but ith some honeyed sweetness. Another decent beer here offering

Bottle. Two finger white foam. Plenty of malty aromas. Pronounced awesome sweet caramel taste and finish. Good heavy body and soul. Like this brew. I fell full after one pint.

(bottle - 500 ml) Dark brown pour with a fluffy tan head. Sweet and fruity aroma, a bit sweeter than I was expecting actually, along with some spice. Sweet flavor with a nice but subtle hint of rye at the end. Smooth and tasty.

12th May 2012Post CBC in the Hotel -  Oh crap I have bought too many bottles again!   Hazy dark brown beer. Good off white head. Mild caramel malts. Not much rye spice, shame! A little chocolate. Thats it, were done!

50 cl bottle @ home. Pours a reddish brown with a small white head that slowly fades leaving some lacing. Aroma is malt, yeast, dark fruits, wet wood. Taste is malty and yeasty with a slightly bitter finish.
On tap at the porter. Fruity cherry aroma with a malt profile that is chewy grain. Spicey bite on the finish as you would expect from a rye.
Poured a reddish color with an off-white head. Aroma was floral notes with a touch of spice. Flavor was a touch rye, with some wheat notes. Hop character was good.
Pretty average beer here...... Ok,  tons of rye but alas nothing else.  Tastes like a glass of rye soda.  Not bad but not good.

Bottled 500ml (Pikkulintu, batch #592, brygget 160211)
Clear deep ruby color, steady beige head, lace. Ryeish, smoked wet wood in the aroma, Medium-bodied. Caramel, wet wood, rye, alcohol, a bit smokey. Decent.

0.5 l bottle at Harrys, Jyväskylä. Dark reddish brown color with thick head. Sweet aroma of toffee, nuts, pine, juniper and citrus. Bittersweet toffeish flavor with more pine and citrus. Full bodied. Not bad, but from the name and the high price I expected something more unusual, not just another strong hoppy beer.
Meh, been sitting on this for a while. Too much gummy rye flavors. Not much else, not really a beer. Too malty
Bottled.Thanks Jacob.Dark brown appearance with aroma of,roasted malt,rye and brown bread.Flavors of,grain,sourdough,sweet malt,fig and licorice.
Pours dark red with a low tan head. Aroma is malts. Flavor is malts, dark fruits, some rye and alcohol. A bit boring but decent.

Appearance: deep garnets and claret hues under a khaki head which fades with a nice collar and spots of lace. A thin puddly bubble lingers on top. Swirls creamy and thick with no additional lace.

Nose: spice, chocolate powder, stewed apricots and peaches. Cocoa nibs. Plums and raisins. Roasted chestnuts and almonds. Leather wine sacks. Rye seeds, rye whiskey, rye crackers and rye toast.

Palate: peach and apricot pits. Rustic in the back with leather wine sacks infused with years of holding robust earthy spicy red wines. Burlap. Apple orchards and deconstructed apples  apple seeds and apple skins. Spicy finish with the sweet heat of rye whiskey. Oaky tannic finish on the back of my tongue. Chocolate truffles with rye whiskey inside. Toasted almonds.

Final Thoughts: thanks first to my sister for whom I was able to taste this wonderful beer from Copenhagen, Denmark. Also thanks to Nogne-O for allowing Beer Here to brew this wonderful beer at their brewery.

(Bottle, 0.5 l -  Nøgne batch #592, at Pikkulintu, 20120424) The beer poured brown and quite clear. Aroma had molasses, sweetness, Belgian style yeast and malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were molasses, sweetness, chocolate, Belgoan style yeast, hops, roasted malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was sweetness, mild sourness and bitterness. The beer tasted like a Belgian ale and the rye was too hidden for me. Not a bad beer but not special either.

0.5l bottle courtesy of and shared with Beer3000. I really like the history behind this beer. It pours as a deep deep ruby color with a nice everlasting small just off-white head. On the aroma I get caramel, some chocolate, hints of strawberry and some dark malts. Its average to softy carbonated and has a comfortable silky texture in the mouth. Flavors of chocolate, dry espresso coffee, some fruity dark tone, and a touch of light mouthdrying  rye. It just feels overall so soft and gentle all the way, and Im really thankful that I got to try this one, Big big thanks! 29.03.2012

Dark brown. Malty aroma. Sweet and malty flavour followed by pleasant bitterness

Bottle, orange-brown with loads of sedaments floating. Beige small head. Caramel, licirice, a little tartness in the nise. Medium sweetness, licorice, light bitterness. Soft carb, very nice....

Bottle pour red large head tastes and smells of rye floral hops caramel chocolate roasty. Very nice hardly abu carb on tongue bitter in middle light finish. Really nice beer with lots of flavors that mix well.

Bottle. Very high and long lasting off-white head. Clear very dark red brown body. Choccolate caramel bread dustry aroma. Mild choccolate coffee hops roasted malt flavor. Low carbonation. Long aftertaste.

#1383 bottle from kulturkøbmanden; nose is cake, sweet alcohol, rye, little cloves, later decent espresso crema, smoke finish, feel is mediumbroad, carb is mediumheavy, taste is decent rye, mediumsweet roasted malt, rotten fruit, weak mushroom, some sweet tobacco, cola note, late weak sweet smoke, cereal
Aroma of dark fruits, oatmeal, and bread.  Pours deep red with good lacing.  Taste is very flavorful!  Notes of coffee, dark fruits and a good opening bite from the rye.  Very good ride.
draft at Blue Monk, darker copper pour. Rich maltiness, black licorice, toffee, malted milk balls, light chocolate, some herbalness. Agressive flavor. Unique. Interesting beer

Bottle at home. Pours a clear dark brown with an off-white head and hints of lacings. Sweet with malty aromas of caramel and dried fruits. Also hints of rye. Medium bodied. Medium carbonation. Dry finish with more rye.

Deep dark ruby body with short off-white head. Rye on the nose along with a hint of smoke, chocolate and liquorice also coming through in the taste, medium body, alcohol well hidden and very easy to drink, could go back for more of this.

Sampled at an ESBLS tasting.  I brought it.  Dark brown with a bit of red.  A beige funky head.  Lots of malt here but there is more than just malt going on.  Fruit and dark fruit.  Raisins.  This is nice.

(50 cl bottle from Toft Vin; Batch 592; Brewed on February 16th 2011) Pours a frothy off-white that recedes quickly but leaves a nice, small head and lace. Aroma is barn-like yesty, hay and horsesweat(?). Oily texture, soft carbonatoin, fully body and a somewhat tart finish. Taste is mildy sour. Probably a great historic reenactment but for me its not the greatest taste experience..

Bottle at Atticus Finch. Great strong ale. Aromas of smoke, liquorice, chocolate, grain, and hints of alcohol. Palate is sweet and bitter, with very long length. Palate is creamy, and full bodied. Brown and cloudy.

Aroma: Roasted malts. Cocoa and toffee. Rye. Spice. Bread. 

Appearance: Thick beige one finger creamy head with long retention. Brown leather color. Thick, hazy, unfiltered. 

Taste: Sourdough rye bread, cocoa flavors. Pepper, caramel malt. 

Palate: Malts contribute a thick and creamy mouth.

Overall: Delicious, well balanced and flavorful.

Brown with a low head. Malty aroma with notes of bread, caramel and rye. The flavour is primarily sweet with a metallic bitterness, that doesnt do it for me. The rye is clearly present, but nevertheless a bit dissapointing.

Bottle. Pours a very hazy with a yellowish brown head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a good amount of rye with backing dark bread and a bit of alcohol. Flavor is full of dark bread and rye with a bit of backing alcohol.

Bottle.  Pours a dark brown with a super foamy tan head (started coming out of the bottle after opening).  Aroma of sweet fruits, roasted malt, bready malt, and a hint of spicy rye.  Flavor is earthy, sweet malt, fig.  Really little rye here though.  Overall ok, but nothing special or complex.

Pours a clear and dark brown beer with a large offwhite head. The aroma is malt, caramel and bread. The flavor follows the nose with additional alcohol. The palate is sweetness. Overall an average beer.

Block like biege head medium carbonation mahogany tone pour the aromas vanilla fruit maltiness notes of chocolate smooth grain the rye hint of coffee the flavours smooth resiny taste coffee chocolate rich medium bitter vanilla rye smooth gives it a good balance sweet caramel the finish main aftertaste smooth dark malts sweet aswell lasting bitter vanilla like it
Bottle. Hazy amber-brown por with a medium off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty (øllebrød!), caramel, spices and a hint of yeast.  Taste is malty, rye. Light bitter finish.

200ml, on tap at Schouskjelleren. Beige head, hazy, dark brown body. Smell of chocolate malts and floral-fruity hops. Fruit chocolate in flavour mixed with a twist of spicy hops. Dry bitter tail that lasted for quite a while. Pleasing (Oslo, 23.01.2012).

On tap at Schouskjelleren.
Dark brown, tones of red, big beige head.
Rich aroma of malt and spices, roasty taste with coffee, floral hops, fruit.
Nice spiced finish. Instant classic

Pours dark amber with a thick tan head. Nose is light caramel and spice. Not real strong scents of anything really. Taste is smoke, bitter and lightly sweet. Mouthfeel is crisp. Light body with high carbonation.

(500ml bottle)  Pours a dark mahogany body with a tall beige head.  Aroma of roasted malt, rye, toasted coconut, chocolate, nuts, citrus, caramel, and raisins.  Flavor of cola, roasted malt, rye, raisins, caramel, and chocolate.
Pours dark brown, almost like Coke with a huge frothy light tanned head. Aroma of burnt malt and rye bread. Taste is moderate sweet malty sugary with a distinct dry and hoppy end. Quite good

Big beige head. Hazy deep red translucent body. Light fruity dusty perfumy aroma with spicy paint notes. Dry-sweet wheaty roasty rye taste with dusty strawy notes. Fullish body. Bottle Clear, dark copper ale with a mid-sized, creamy, mushroom-colored head. Great retention. The nose offers caramel and rye malt with a faint smoky component. Medium-bodied with lively carbonation. The spicy, tangy flavor presents toffee, mocha and light bitterness. Crisp, mildly bitter, lightly smoky finish. Bottle courtesy of Plovmand!
Dark red, not quite black. Smells like like dark toast and grapes. Seems a little lighter than I was expecting. Flavor is a lot Burnt toast, grape jam, and a dry, woody finish.
Bottle shared by hopscotch.  Brown pour with a tan head.  Rye and toasted malt aromas.  Hoppy with roasted malt and bread/cereal notes.

(in bottle) very drk brown/reddish, steady, white head. heavy malted, sparkling nose, sourdough notes, grainy sent. Perfedt carbonation takes the alcohol and the semi-tart malt taste to a new high. Very impressive balance between the rye and it´s firm palate and a zingy, refreshing mouthfeel. Lashing sugars in the finish, makes a really nice pair with the alcoholic feel and the woody/dry malted notes. Proud to be nordic, am I.

Draft pours deep red with tons of haze, thin head with big bubbles, moderate retention.  Aroma is rey spice, big caramel sweetness, chocolate nuttiness.  Taste is chocolate, smoke, bready rye spice, leather, biscuit, molasses, raisin, kind of like a small barleywine.  Body is full, big and oily, medium carbonation, rye chocolate toasty finish.  overall, pretty damn good.
Draft. Pours deep amber with a beige head. Toasty malty aroma with lighter rye notes. The flavor has spicy rye, lightly roasted malts, and toasted grains. Decent.

500 ml. Deep chocolate-mahogany with a lasting large sponge of foam. Nose is semi-sweet chocolate, caramel, rice krispies, peppery resin, orange. Taste is dark chocolate, orange, puffed rice, resin, black pepper, light bloody charred steak, salty iodine, red wine, ash and hickory smoke. Heavy body is sweet and sticky with malt, softly carbonated, and well dried on the finish with the char alcohol, and smoke.
Colour is dark red and head is tan. Quite a roasty aroma and taste, some hops as well. (Bottle)

500mL bottle
Hazy bronze body, thick creamy white head holds strong!
Nice aroma; lots of caramel and molasses, caraway seed, pepper, earthy and woody spice, and banana esters.
Chewy texture, lovely fullness and creamy carbonation. Bit of warmth on the way down.
Sweet deep caramels combine with pumpinickel and earthy/woody spice on the body. Some phenolic yeast character and dark fruit esters. Complex, and rather lovely!
Guessing this a like a Sahti of sorts. Cant help but admire this style; flavours are complex and just generally nice, texture has the almost velvet-like character of a good Belgian strong. Really good!

50 cl bottle from ØlKonsortiet. Pours beautiful chestnut brown with a steady one finger head. Aroma is up front with fruity esters and malty sweetness. Fresh figs, roasted rye, rye bread, fudgy caramel, dates, almonds, maple syrup, smoke, maybe even a hint of chocolate milk. Taste is very mild for an 8% beer. As it warms, a deep woody note occurs. Very nice aroma. Fruity esters and rye are main components, the rye adding a slightly spicy touch, some smoky malts, hints of tobacco. Dark rye bread and burned crust give a bitter touch to a rather sweet palate. This beer cements my love for rye beers. Really delicious and a great winter warmer.

500 ml bottle from Wine and Cheese Place. Pours a semi-cloudy reddish amber with a small off-white head. Aroma of rye, toasted malts, sweet bread, dry yeast, pepper and a little bit of fruit. Flavor of rye, toasted caramel malts, graham crackers, dried berries, and wood. Medium body, with moderate carbonation and a spicy mouthfeel. Nice, unique beer.
Brown bodied, big soapy head, very lacey.  Malty and very yeasty.  So-so drinkable. Thanks Peeno.
500 ml from Louisville Beer Store. Caramel and toffee taste that is really matly and nice. Sweetness doesnt overpower. Bit of alcohol bite. Nice.

Draft at Ginger Man in NYC. The pour yields a lightly hazy, dark chestnut colored body with a small, smooth, cream colored head that quickly settles to a thin film.  A soapy wash mostly rejoins the body, save for a few thin, splotchy flares. Aromas very much show the rye from the name, suggesting of fresh rye bread and dry toasted caramel, touching on almost burnt
cookie, dry cacao, and mild gingerbread spice. Flavors show a similar balance of sweet malt and roast, loaded with spicy rye, baked bread, and dryish choco-caramel.  It drinks easy for an 8% brew, thanks largely to the smooth, easy going, moderately substantive palate.  Carbonation is soft and balanced.  The finish is lightly drying, with just a little bit of sticky residual sugar.  Overall, its a very solid beer.  Id gladly drink this again.

Delicious rye beer! I let it warm a bit out of the fridge, then poured a good sized, foamy, frothy, tan head that settled after a little and a few lacings. Color is a hazy/cloudy apricot copper. Aroma is fairly mild - rye, malt,  hint of yeast. Flavor is similar with only a little sweetness to stand up to some big tang although the carbonation seems fairly smooth. Also a big smoke component that works real well. Finish is like flavor, kind of long and has some alcohol in it. Great brew!

Bottle @ home. Cloudy, brown appearance with a good sized, light brown head. Slightly sour rye malty, bready yeasty aroma. Mildly sour rye, light sourdough bready, a touch dark fruity, tangy, juniper flavor. Fun beer.

500ml Bottle:  Aroma of malt, rye, and slight anise.  Poured very deep amber/brown in color with a small, creamy, dense, brown head that diminished but lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Sparkling.  Full of small, medium, and large-sized particles throughout.  Ok lacing.  Flavor is lightly sweet and light to medium bitter.  Tastes of malt, rye, dark bread, and hops.  Medium body.  Tingly, then dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Malt, rye, and light hop finish is dry.  8%ABV is completely hidden throughout.

Pours to a deep brown body with a slow carbonation and a tall, lively tan head.  The aroma is spicy rye malts and chocolate.  Earthy malts with some very subtle lightly soapy hops.  The flavor is quite malty with a big bready pumpernickel and rye.  Hugely malty with some earthy components.  I want to say that this is like a rye-malted scotch / Scottish ale.  Rye wee heavy.  The palate is sweet and has a peppery carbonated sharpness up front.  Mellows and smooths out into a long silken finish.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours surprisingly dark. Was expecting a pale yellow of some sort but instead pours brown with a little light coming through. A solid beige head sits atop for the duration. Nose is all dark chocolate and slight smoke. A very slight touch of lemon comes through. Lots of roasted malts in the taste with a smoked chocolate and slightly woody finish. A very well made beer but just lacks that finishing punch

Bottle at home. Pours deep walnut brown, 1-finger off-white head, very persistent, nice lacing, if a bit spotty. Honestly I was expecting more of a Rye Pale Ale, but this darker brew will do just fine. Nose is very lemony, definitely a hoppy brew, lots of lemon candy and lemongrass, nicely seated atop a very aromatic and spicy malt base. The spice is very prevalent, and almost cedary, and does seem to be coming from the malt (the rye?) rather than the hops, though I could certainly be mistaken. Flavours are rich, smoky, and dare I say it: A bit reminiscent of HOTD Adam... Big and smoky and rich, some raisiny/tobacco sweetness, but overall quite dry. The 8% alcohol is remarkably well-hidden, with no real heat noticeable, although the finish is a touch shorter than I had perhaps expected. A lovely brew all around.

Bottle. Dark brown with huge dense brown head. Aroma initially malt, rye, sugar later more roasted amlt notes takes over. Taste roasted malts and some hopp bitterness. As it opens up in the glass more roasted malts and chocolate notes comes up. Reminds me a bit of a good stout.
Bottle. Pours a carmelish brown color with a fluffy foamy head. Smells of dough, carmel and rye. Taste is sweet and nutty like a brown ale almost. Interesting , but pretty good nonetheless

Bottle, 13C. Reddish brown with a large beige head. Aroma is spicy with bread and singed caramel. Theres pepper and aniseed, hard spices and some sour notes. Taste is sweet with darkish caramel before substantial roasted malt thats not obvious in the nose, spicy bitterness and a touch of sourness and smoke at the end. Tastes a little less exotic than it smells, but strikes a nice balance of rustic and polished.

0.5L bottle. Many tanks to Beer2000 for this one!  A finger of dense, lightly tanned cream head. Hazed, reddish-brown body.  Soft and gently sweet aroma of rye bread, creamed caramel and mild roast. Taste is soft malty and fully balanced.   Bakery with rye, light peppery caramel, some nice choco tones, and a gentle spiced bitterness. Suggestions of mint  and anis. Well-bodied and creamy in the mouth. Rounded and complex finish. Nice all over, by far the best rye beer Ive had.

Bottled. Pours deep amber with a large, frothy beige head, that leaves a exellent lacing. Nose with some roast, caramel and spicy notes. Sweet flavor of rye, caramel, licorice, spices and citrus notes. Medium bodied, creamy to oily texture and soft carbobation. ends up with some bitterness and more dry. A quite nice brew.

Pour is darkish brown/red with a medium sized tan head. Aroma is of bready dough, oak, and some sweet caramel. Flavor is well balanced but leaning towards the malty side, dark rye bread, roasted malts, sweet finish. Light to medium bodied and one of the better rye beers Ive had.

Hazy golden pour with a tight white head. The aroma is quite earthy with a nice dustiness in the malts. Lightly tart with a little bit of lacto character but its got a nice balance of malts and soft spicy rye character. A touch of soft sweetness along with a bit of spicy rye on the finish. Its a pretty nice brew - very interesting.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a creamy long lasting off white head. The aroma is highly malty with notes of light toasted malt, caramel, dark fruit and has lighter notes of earthy hops. The flavour is heavy malty with notes of light chocolate, light smoke, toasted caramel and some hops. Creamy texture. Very balanced overall and I just love the malty notes in this brew.

500 ml bottle poured a clear reddish brown with a small lasting tan head. Aromas of rye, cocoa, carmel and a hint of vanilla. Palate was medium bodied and crisp. Flavors of rye, cocoa and carmel with a crisp lingering rye finish.
Bottle from Star Grocery, Berkeley. Pours dark brown with an attractive beige head and a toffee aroma. There is a chewy molasses and chocolate flavor with a slightly sour and bitter finish.

Bottle. Brown beer with a big tan head. Chocolate and light roast aroma with caramel. Chocolate and caramel flavor with yeast, light spice, and earth. Fuller bodied. Chocolate and yeast lingers with caramel, earth, and spice.

Bottle.

Head is initially large, creamy, off-white to light brown, fully lasting.
Body is hazy medium amber/brown, bottle conditioned.

Aroma is moderately malty (toasted grain/bread, caramel, cookie), lightly to moderately hoppy (apricot, resin), with light notes of smoke, wintergreen/mint.

Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium body, creamy texture, lively carbonation, moderately alcoholic.

Beautiful appearance, one of the most truly creamy, densely compacted heads this side of the "artificial" nitro look.  Fun and enjoyable aroma, although admittedly a little mild and unfocused/disconnected.  Decent flavor balance (bit tart though), nice mouthfeel, although a little lighter bodied than the ABV would suggest.  Overall a solid, pleasing, well-made brew, but it doesnt have a strong enough identity or standout trait to push it into 4+ territory.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown color with reddish notes and a beige head. Aroma is of spicy rye, dark fruits, caramel, toffee, red berries and some breadiness,. The flavor is again mostly of spicy rye, with a ryebread breadiness, along with dark fruits, toffee, caramel, over ripe red berries, toasted malt and nutty notes. The body is medium with a lightly silky mouthfeel. Overall a pretty interesting brew, that reminds me a little of a cross between a Barley Wine and a Brown Ale.

Bottle, shared with Parksy. Hazy dark brown with copper highlights. Aroma is chocolate and underlying funky fruit, like sour cherries or something. Caramel and spice are in their too. Interesting. Flavour is chocolate, husky bread crusts, sour cherries, with hints of spice and smoke. Really tasty, interesting.

I had this on tap at Beachwood BBQ in Long Beach.
This beer poured a dark reddish-brown and had  a one finger, creamy white head The flavor had some nice complexity with good spiciness & hops. Id order it again.

I have no idea what this beer is supposed to be the bottle says modern farm house ale, one site says its a traditional ale another a spiced ale, and to me it tastes, looks, and smells like a porter. This beer is suffering from an identity crises. Cola brown body with average looking cap.  Smokey malts, chocolate, weird hidden funk, hints of sweet coffee. Bitterness is lingering in the back of my throat. Taste like an American porter. This beer is annoying me! Brew is tuning into a cold cup of coffee with hints of sweet smokey chocolate. Do i taste rye? sure why not. I hate this beermaybe hates to strong od a word.

On tap. Pours with a hazed bronze body with a lasting off-white head. Aromas are smokey and spicy, a bit roasty as well. Maple, slightly sweet, fruity esters and a bit grainy. Flavors are malty, caramel grainy, spicy and woodsy. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

Courtesy of ekstedt. Pours dark brown with a great bubbly tanned head leaving lace. Aroma is malty, bready, a bit fruity, hoppy and spicy. Flavor is very malty, sweet, syrupy, fruity, dark fruits, chocolate and has a good bitterness. Finishes bitter malty.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2014 Bottle (50 cl) from Ölbutikken, Copenhagen, Denmark. Shady deep mahogny, large beige head. Fruity, nutty, chocolatey, with some floral hops. Medium bodied, soft carbonation. Dry to semi dry, medium bitterness.

Poured out a deep reddish amber with a very compact light brown cap that leaves a bit of lacing. Weird aroma - honey, odd alcoholic 2x4s, hints of chocolate, background cherry like funk, powdery, goodness sort of. Interesting taste but, yeah.. Light funk early on but more funky later but its the strange bitterness early on is cool. Rye, other things. For half the bottle this was a dull American porter. Raisin, bitter low flavoured chocolate. Intersting beer but not interesting enough.

500 ml bottle kindly shared by Sigmund. Pours a murky mahogany body with a creamy, inch thick, light brown head. Brett spicy, light roasted, toasted and smoked notes on the nose. Sweet, alcoholic, roasted and bitter. Full body. Smooth. Leaves a dry tongue.

Pours a rich brown color with a light brown head.  Smells a bit funky.  Little sour with some chocolate.  Pretty roasty and malty taste.  Slight sour taste at the beginning.  Doesnt last very long.  Nice burnt coffee and chocolate flavors.  I like.

Pours a dark ruby highlighted mahogany with a thick finger of yellowish beige head. A good amount of sticky lacing. On the nose, there is a predominant sweet caramel and rye bread aroma with honey, citrus hops and brown sugar. The middle is primarily sweet and grainy with a bready caramel malt with tons of brown sugar and rye grain. On the finish there is a moderate bitter and dry hop with no alcohol presence. A full and chewy beer with no carbonation and good thick head texture. Overall, a very good and drinkable beer.
(Bottle 27/08-2011) Low beige head, clear dark amber color, dry slightly smoked taste.

Pours murky brown with plenty of head.  Aromas - caramel malt, pepper, raisin, nuts, maybe a bit of red wine. Alcohol is noticeable.  Perhaps too bubbly for my liking.  Quite dry, with lingering bitterness.
Bottle @ Voldby beerfest.  Pours hazy brown with a tan head. Aroma of malt, nuts, rye, spieces. Taste is malt, yeast, caramel, nuts, berries, rye, rather sweet. Medium body, soft carbonation. 270811
Unclear brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, dark malty, rye and nutty. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 270811
Bottle. Dark brown/orange with small tan head. Flavour is light roasted malt, caramel, hops, fruit, little bitter, rye and notes of smoke.

Bottle. Dark copper with a lasting foam. Dark malt scent with a bit of spice. Some alcohol in the nose as it warms. Nice balance of malt, alcohol and warm spice in the flavour. A nice lite stout - saison type cross. Noticeable rye note.  What he said. But I liked it.

Bottle. Dark copper with a lasting foam. Dark malt scent with a bit of spice. Some alcohol in the nose as it warms. Nice balance of malt, alcohol and warm spice in the flavour. A nice lite stout - saison type cross. Noticeable rye note.

Bottle from Wine & Cheese in Clayton, MO. Pours very dark brown with a creamy/foamy light beige/tan head. Aroma from the bottle is suggestive of coffee. Through the foam its chocolate. Med+ body. Flavor is rye with some chocolate. Its interesting. No extreme flavors. Mellow. Id say the finish is chocolate rye.
Bottle @ Voldby ølmesse. Nice head with good duration. Color is brown. Aroma and taste are roast malt, nuts, caramel and hops.

500ml brown bottle. Brown pour. Frothy and creamy light tan head. Sports some nice sticky clingy lace. Aroma has rye whisky, and sweet malts, slight spicy hints. Flavour has a bit of chocolate malts, hint of roast and rye. Some woody and toasty qualities. Finsihes with a bit of leafy bitterness, light alcohol/rye lingers. Medium body, tight carbonation. Very nice strong rye ale.
Bottle. dark amber colour with a beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, pine, floral, hop. Flavour is roasted malt, rye, yeasy, pine, spices. Nice beer.

DØE Festival, Valby, DK.
Tap, 270511.
Amber with off-white head. Aroma of malt and spices. Flavor with some berry and spiced tone (rye)

Botle. Pours a dark reddish brown color with a small off-white head. Has a weak roasted malty rye bread aroma. Fruity malty slightly vinous dark fruit flavor with rye bread. Has a fruty malty caramel and dark fruit finish.

ken would like this brewery .. . Poured out a dark tan, good foam .. . light spice, light rye bread, and burnt hops .. .medium gritty mouth .. . an interesting brew, quite nice- toms favourite brew .. . Oh, Im in no condition to drive. Wait a minute. I dont have to listen to myself. Im drunk.

Very dark brown pour at Churchkey. Great nose of chocolate, pumpernickel, bready yeast, and caramel. Flavor holds more good chocolate presence, rye grain, and toasted sesame. Medium body with good carbonation. Very nice stuff.

Draft.  Small beige head, murky dark brown body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, caramel, toast, rye, some smoke, light roast.  Taste is moderately sweet, caramel, some smoldering smoke, light raisin/plum, rye.  Medium body, some stickiness, low carbonation.

Shared bottle at Sigmunds, thanks Pours dark brown,  almost like Coke with a huge frothy light tanned head. Aroma of burnt malt and rye bread. Taste is moderate sweet malty sugary with a distinct dry and hoppy end. Quite good and moreish.

500 ml bottle, from Beer2000, thanks! ABV is 8%. Dark reddish brown colour, moderate but lasting creamy off-white to beige head, leaves a nice lacing in the glass. "Farmhouse" aroma with some vinous and woody notes. The flavour is medium sweet and malty with notes of ripe berries and dark dried fruits, also oaky notes, distinct hops in the finish. Very good.

500ml bottle.

Pours dark chestnut brown with a big tan head.  There are hints of hazy amber around the edges and lots of lacing.

Nose is dominated by rye and chocolate malts, and the malts are heavily roasted with the sweetness taking a back seat.  Nice and spicy character overall in the nose.

Taste has a sweeter milky lactose character up front which is backed up by a big roasted chocolate malt foundation.  Then theres the rye which is especially noticeable in the finish and leaves a spicy tingle on the tongue.

The mouthfeel is highly carbonated and crazy smooth which is to be expected with the heavy dose of rye.

Im a huge fan of dark rye beers so I figured Id like this one, and it didnt disappoint.  Hardly a farmhouse style beer, but no reason to let stylistic semantics get in the way of a great beer.  Recommended.

On tap at Churchkey yesterday. Served in a mini-snifter.

Pours a medium brown color with a good off-white head. Decent retention and falls into a thin cap. The nose brings forward a good amount of spicy rye plus some pine-needle character. Flavor pulls back on the pine and is more earthy with some rye. Also some toasted bread and a bit of faint sweetness. Medium body with a good amount of bitterness and spice. Interesting. This is something Id have again.

500mL bottle poured dark brown with big beige head with good retention and nice lacing.  Aromas of roasted malt.  Nice balance of malt and hops.  Full bodied and moderate carbonation.  A very nice Danish beer.

Pours a deep reddish brown with a beige head.  Aroma is dark rye bread, floral hops, earth, caramel and a bit of cocoa.  The taste has a bit more rye spice and its mildly dry.  Its a pretty light on the palate for an 8% abv beer with a dark, earthy profile.  The touches of floral/citric hops and rye spice add a lot to the deeper bready/cocoa notes.  Good stuff.

Pours a ruddy ruby garnet with two fingers of creamy sandstone head. Notes of cacao and bread in the nose with a lite earthiness and peppery notes. Very stoutish. Roasty flavor with notes of juniper and vanilla bean. Very interesting. Extremely carbonated mouthfeel, dry and a it astringent.

Very spicy aroma with a bit of yeast as well.  The appearance is dark amber with heavy cloudiness.  The flavor is again spicy and also spicy,  with hints at vegetables in the spices.  Not bad really, I just dont care for strongly spicy ales, although I can appreciate them.
Drft at makke, on a night of talking, not rating.  Tasted like eating a yeast sandwich on rye bread, in a good way.

Bottle, thanks ethan for sharing.  Cloudy brownish amber with a medium sized off-white head. Nose of unknown berries, roast, rye, herbs, earth, cocoa.  Flavor of spice, rye, herbs, roast, cocoa.  FInishes a little bitter.  Doesnt stand out in any way really.  A bit of yawner.

16-JUL-2011, bottle @home, from "Ølbutikken".
Brown with beige lasting head.
Dark berries that I cannot nail.
Herbal, charamelly, creamy.
Nice carbonation and mouthfeel.
A strange beast but fine.

50 cl bottle from Ölbutikken. Dark brown/mahogany liquid with big off-white head. Malty aroma with notes of caramel, toffee, bread, roasted malt and spices. Taste is also malty with some roasted notes coming through and a nice, medium bitterness and light sweetness. Nice balance. Medium to full bodied with OK carbonation and nice, smooth mouthfeel.
Deep copper with a lasting off-white head. Aroma of malt and toffee with a hint of husk and tannin. Deep sweetish caramel and toffee malt flavour with a touch of spicy and grassy hops

Brown ale with a decent head. Earthy aroma of grain, some cocoa, flavor has a hint a chocolate in there over a solid base of grain. Some earth mushroom, forest floor essence. Full bodied, well balanced beer. Very nice
50cl, new Danish brew Anno 2011, thx to MadsNP!, complex brew, spicy, slightly roasted/bitter, not too heavy, balanced, hazy, rocky head, good brew, yet expensive
Aroma: rye malty  sweet, bready like. Hazy deep dark brown colour, medium beige head. Good mouthfeel. Flavour is sweet dark malty bready with rye.
On tap @Macche. It seemed a little bit strong to me. No carbonation with a medium head at low persistence. Nothing very special for me, but I think its a good product.

Bottle 500ml.Unclear medium to dark red brown colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, roasted, caramel, rye. Flavour is moderate to light heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a average to long duration, dark malt, rye, roasted, sweet malt. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110527]

Bottled. A hazy deep red beer with a huge tan head. The aroma has notes of malt, rye, spices, caramel, and subdued spices. The flavor is sweet with notes of rye, malt, citrusy hops, caramel, bread, and some spices, leading to a bitter finish.

Bottled at Københavnske Øldage 2011. Hazy brownish amber, minimal head. Aroma of bread, plastic and grapefruit. Medium-full bodied with clean, rounded mouthfeel. Hops are very much there, yet focus is shifted to syrup and plastic. Long salty bitterness.

Bottle @ Ølfestival, 2011.
Light muddy chestnut with a small, frothy, off-white head. Aroma has chocolate, rye, light spicy. Medium carbonation, fine and very dry grainy mouthfeel. Flavour is sweet, malty, rye bread, light chocolate, liqourice. Very lovely and tasty.

An OK rye ale, a genre Id deliberately targeted for the festival as I havent had many such beers before.
Draught at Copenhagen Beer Festival 2011. Dark amber colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, hops, rye, spice and chocolate.
Draught at DBF 2011. Dark amber with an off-white head. Aroma moderate malty (roasted, rye, spicy). Flavor medium sweet. Medium body, soft.

Bottle 500ml @ yngwie
Pours cloudy dark amber with a creamy off-white head. Aroma has notes of rosted malt, alcohol, pine and floral hops. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Copenhagen Beer Festival, 2011. Pours amber with a small creamy white head. Burnt malts, chocolate and caramel. Medium bodied. Dry and bitter end.

Bottle at Copenhagen Beer Festival 2011. 
Clear orange red coloured with a medium sized beige head.
Malty and light roasted aroma of caramel and dark chocolate.
Malty flavour of caramel and dark chocolate with roasted notes.
Roasted finish.
Bottle at København ØLfestival 2011. Clear amber - offwhite head. Caramel, fruity, nutty, grassy, berries, rye, ok hoppy, herbal, licorice, fruity, roasted, light bitterness.

500 ml bottle. Hazy amber body with a beautiful, long lasting, dense, light beige head. Complex aroma of malt, caramel, fruit, hops and spices. Flavor is pleasant, quite strong and feels almost warming. Malt, grain, caramel, light roast, fruit, spices and bitter hops. Very nice and a bit odd.
clear amber, smooth light brown head. malty aroma, sweet rye. flavor is malty, licorice, dark malty, herbal notes play very well in.

Bottle. Frothy white good mostly deminishing head. Dark red-amber colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Burnt and roasted notes. Moderate bitter flavor. Candis notes. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate.
50 cL bottle. Pours dark brown to black with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted dark malty, annis seed and caramelish. Bitter, dark and hard roasted malty finish. Ends bitter and dark malty finish.

Bottle. A dense, tow-finger beige head sits on top of an almost clear reddish brown body. Roasted malts dominates the aroma, but theres 
also dried fruits, some pleasant malty sourness, chocolate, alcohol hints and a good dash of piney hops. Its super-smooth in the mouth, full-bodied and a bit warming. Theres lots of flavors too, enough piney hops to deal with the sweet and roasted maltyness. Long bitterness in the else roasted finish. A wonderful beer I hope will be available on a regular basis in Norway. 110524

Bottled. Dark amber coloured. Light brown head. Aroma of roast, sweetness, syrup, flowers. Flavou ris sweet, light roasty, has caramel and some cocoa. Medium bodied. Is sweet and light bitter in the end.

On tap. Pours a deep dark amber with a slight haze and a creamy and lacing off-white head. Sweet balanced roastiness in the nose. Solid body, sweet roast and licorice, with a solid bitterness and quite some alcohol in the finish. Doesnt really look like a Stout but tastes like one! 270511
